testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
-config a remote CVG, there is several LANs behind it -there are some services in CVG's LANs -BR setup VPN connection with the CVG -setup all wifi radios and eth interfaces as access mode -bind the user-profile with several aid -bind two ssid with this user-profile, but uses different aid
Test Procedure:
-STA connects to this two ssid -check the ip forward policy

step.desc: enable wan port nat if FW nonexists
config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: config mgt0.2 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.multi-setvar: echo "br1.br.mgt0.1.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "br1.br.mgt0.2.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns2.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.vpc1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0"

step.desc: Check route distribution is correct
On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
-check the ip route tablelist
setup eth interfaces as access mode -bind the user-profile with several aid
config all Radios as access mode, set vlan br1.vpc1.vlan
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int3} switchport mode trunk" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int3} switchport trunk native vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int3} switchport user-profile-attribute 1"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.1
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
AP1 as Laptop2 connect to lan port eth3
step.console: -v "interface mgt0 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0 native-vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "" -v "" -v "interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "" -v ""

step.desc: show AP1 mgt0
get ip address of ap1
enable debug on BR
step.telnet: -v "clear log buffered" -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 2 src-ip ${br1.ap1.mgt0.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail"

step.desc: Bind user-profile with l3-tunnel-action all 1. The different aid point to the same user-profile, so it will map to the same user-profile index, the same ip-policy used, forward should be the same
Bind user-profile with l3-tunnel-action all
step.telnet: -v "routing match-map mlan1 user-profile lan1 to any" -v "routing route-map rlan1 via encrypted" -v "routing policy plan1 id 1 match-map mlan1 route-map rlan1"

step.desc: -check the Tunnel All tunnel-all Routing Table
-STA1 ping web server on internet default traffic is via tunnel
show log buffer
AP1 as Laptop2 connect to lan port eth3
show log buffer
Bind user-profile with l3-tunnel-action drop-tunnel-traffic
Bind user-profile with l3-tunnel-action drop-tunnel-traffic
step.telnet: -v "no routing policy plan1" -v "no routing route-map rlan1" -v "no routing match-map mlan1" -v "routing match-map mlan1 user-profile lan1 to private" -v "routing route-map rlan1 via blackhole" -v "routing policy plan1 id 1 match-map mlan1 route-map rlan1"

step.desc: -check the Tunnel All With tunnel-drop Routing Table
-STA1 ping web server on internet default traffic is via tunnel
show log buffer
AP1 as Laptop2 connect to lan port eth3
show log buffer
Bind user-profile with l3-tunnel-action with l3-tunnel-action with-exception
Bind user-profile with l3-tunnel-action with-exception
step.telnet: -v "no routing policy plan1" -v "no routing route-map rlan1" -v "no routing match-map mlan1" -v "routing match-map mlan1 user-profile lan1 to any" -v "routing match-map mlan1_1 user-profile lan1 to network ${cvg1.dns1.ip}/32" -v "routing route-map rlan1 via encrypted" -v "routing route-map rlan1_1 via ${br1.br.wan.int1}" -v "routing policy plan1 id 2 match-map mlan1 route-map rlan1" -v "routing policy plan1_1 id 1 match-map mlan1_1 route-map rlan1_1"

step.desc: -check the Tunnel All With Exception Routing Table
-STA1 ping web server on internet default traffic is via tunnel
show log buffer
AP1 as Laptop2 connect to lan port eth3
show log buffer
